website_summaries.verdict: A fully adjustable, heavy-duty workout bench designed for a wide variety of free-weight exercises.
pros: Constructed with commercial quality steel that can support up to 480 lb
There is a 30 yr. warranty on the frame
The adjustable bench features 6 different positions that help maintain a correct stable posture for safe and proper lifting
cons: You might need a brief adjustment period to get used to the feel of the equipment

website_summaries.verdict: One of the best workout benches available, and an affordable foundation for numerous workout possibilities.
pros: A sturdy bench that's built to last
Provides decent workouts w/6 positions and up to 90-degree incline
cons: It's heavy, and assembly is challenging
It doesn't incline to a flat position, which may eliminate some exercises

customer_reviews.title: Do you need 30 degrees and 60 degrees ???
customer_reviews.text: This is a TERRIFIC BENCH, but it is missing two useful inclinations: 30 degrees and 60 degrees. If you have a 1” x 4” piece of lumber, a couple of wood screws and some glue, you can fix that. See the photos. I made mine about 6” long. The length you use will determine the angle of the inclination. I was too lazy to actually pull out the protractor, but I think it’s pretty close. It works for me; maybe it will work for you too — very stable and sturdy!
customer_reviews.author: DawgBone

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this cheesy bench
customer_reviews.text: Just a plain waste of money. Its a pain to install the seat and back rest, plus 3 of the 4 screw holes in the seat are stripped, as is 1 on the back rest. Called bowflex, and they said they were sending a replacement, its now been 5 months and no replacement has come. If only i sent it back instead of called bowflex, then maybe id have a safe bench by now. Will never buy another product made by this company. Can we give 0 stars? Spend less money on lame commercials and build a better product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Painful gap between cushions
customer_reviews.text: The issue I have with this is probably only relevant with certain workouts, but is a significant design flaw. When the bench is flat or at a decline, there is a large gap between the cushions. The gap reveals some very uncomfortable metal parts that end up right where your rear end is. I am much taller than my wife, but this problem doesn’t seem to descriminate by size. I wish I had seen a review like this before I bought the bench.
customer_reviews.author: mgos

customer_reviews.title: Save your box for this one!
customer_reviews.text: I will probably return. And that should be interesting because I’ve assembled and recycled all the packing. What i don’t like: to adjust it’s a cheap threaded bolt, not a push pin or handle you lift up like most. And to get it to land and the holes is a bit of a pain. Second, the first time i sat on it and bent over to grab a dumbbell i herd the partial board that the bench is made of snap. It was loud, and now the area under my left leg is a little saggy. This was on the first use, with light weight. I’m not a happy camper. Save your boxes people!
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: This was a disappointing purchase. The amount I paid I figure it would at least be stable.. not even close. Can’t get much weight benched when wobbling around. Also,, came with a tear in the seat. I would of sent it back but to much after getting it together. Just ate the cost and won’t make that mistake again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent bench. Helped me lose 40 pounds and get ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent bench. Helped me lose 40 pounds and get toned the last year. Very sturdy at all 4 adjustment levels. One of the main reasons I bought this bench was support for my head and neck and many other benches appeared (or were reviewed) to be too short. This bench is very comfortable for my 6'2" height. While other benches have more increments, the 4 (straight up, 45 degree, flat and negative/inverted) are all that I've ever needed. The two wheels make moving it very simple but the legs/feet keep it very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Matt S

customer_reviews.title: Terrible quality control
customer_reviews.text: The bars that support the seat are welded at any angle preventing the seat from being mounted. Pretty sad that bowflex hasn't corrected this problem considering there are reviews over 2 years old with the same problem as I just came across. Last time I purchase anything bowflex.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: 100% regret this purchase
customer_reviews.text: As a flat bench or at a 45-degree angle, it does it’s job. However due to how the seat and the back are positioned and the back of the seat is cut square, it’s ridiculously difficult to get it upright at the 90-degree setting. It’s so difficult, in fact, that I’ve given up. So, 2 stars because it does a third of what it’s made to do. Frankly, I’m really disappointed and completely regret this purchase. I wish the thing would just fall apart so I could justify buying a different one. I would’ve returned it if the packaging weren’t damaged in transit.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Barton

customer_reviews.title: Great except for one thing
customer_reviews.text: Excellent bench in this price range. Well constructed, went together perfectly in about an hour. Very stable, no wobbles. Pretty easy to change bench positions. I find it very comfortable and don't understand the complaints about the gap. This bench is great for taller people like myself. Might not be great if you're short. My main complaint is that the Amazon description says the leg attachment is removable, when in fact it is not. It's a little annoying sometimes. It's a pretty big bench but folded up it can stand in its own and fit in a good sized closet (make sure your closet is big enough). I live in an apartment so this is a great feature.
customer_reviews.author: GB

customer_reviews.title: Five stars.
customer_reviews.text: Five stars. Very comfortable, sturdy, easy to assemble, and a small footprint for my very small home gym (see pic).
customer_reviews.author: TomHunter1968

customer_reviews.title: Great bench extremely well made
customer_reviews.text: I'm so glad I got this bench (along with the SelectTech dumbbells). I live in a remote area where a gym membership is impractical. I was honestly skeptical about my own ability to motivate myself and stick to a routine with a home gym. Partly that is because in the past I've tried it but usually with less than great or hand-me-down equipment. It really pays to get something quality like this. The bench was relatively easy to assemble and none of the parts seem cheap or easily worn or broken. It's a solid bench, attractive, ergonomic and comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Proteus

customer_reviews.title: I wouldn't recommend this as a bench, even if its decent for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Its decently priced for an adjustable bench? The padding is relatively comfortable. The foundation is solid. Cons: The material isn't the strongest and I've got a hole forming with minimal usage, and the leg pads are below poor quality and should have been made out of the same material as the bench if the company actually respected its customers. The pads for the adjustment bar keep falling off and needed to be glued. The seat doesn't adjust.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn Moore

customer_reviews.title: Great bench for a home gym
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace an old sit-up bench that was doing double-duty as a weight bench. This is a much nicer product, and I wish I had bout it sooner. It is a large bench - make sure you have the room for it. My only negative is that the wheels don't have much clearance - when moving it over carpet, the legs drag a bit while using the wheels. It's a minor problem, not worth taking off a star. But that's the only negative I've experienced with it.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Carter

customer_reviews.title: Great bench,
customer_reviews.text: Bought this bench to go with my Bowflex 560 DTS Dumbbells, the bench is nearly perfect. Works great for on and partially on bench workouts, like Triceps dips. If you can pay a little more, I would spring for the next level up. But for the price conscience, this one is perfect. I think I will get years and years of use out of this bench. Good luck with your fitness goals...
customer_reviews.author: Jason K

customer_reviews.title: Why is there a huge butt gap?!!!
customer_reviews.text: So this bench is in fact sturdy BUT the gap between the two pieces connecting is huge! As a woman, my butt literally falls into that gap making any exercise super awkward. For someone who is 6`4ish or taller this wouldn't be an issue but for me (i am 5`8) its not comfortable. The quality of the actual bench is great no issues there. I do wish the adjustable top half was a bolt and level type instead of the cheapy pull up and land in place type like a lawn chair.
customer_reviews.author: MARK

customer_reviews.title: good product/customer service needs help
customer_reviews.text: assembled went ok however hinge between bench and back had to much play, called customer service and went thru the typical we're experiencing unusual high call volume after several calls and getting the same greeting, decided to communicate by email, several emails latter asking for solution which they had agreed a bushing was missing, I was told it most efficient for them to call needless to say I informed them it was more efficient for me to return the bench.
customer_reviews.author: roger

customer_reviews.title: Blowflex...
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good for residential consumer equipment...not sure it would hold up to the weight it claims to support but it's a pretty good piece. Still a bit overpriced for made in China BS and stripped screws and particle board design but hey...this is America.
customer_reviews.author: child_of_fire

customer_reviews.title: Solid
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with my purchase of the Bowflex weights, so I decided to get the matching bench. The bench looks great, And it’s easy to assemble. Was less money on Amazon then on the bowflex website and even though it said out of stock it allowed me to order and fulfilled faster then I thought it would. The sturdiness is excellent and it has many angles from flat al the way to a 90 degree angle.
customer_reviews.author: Nycinpolk

customer_reviews.title: LOVE BOWFLEX
customer_reviews.text: If your wondering if this bench is a good choice for you individually, then Im going to inform you that this bench is WORTH THE MONEY AND TIME thats put into it. This bench by itself is phenomenal, especially the sturdiness, but also the easy assembly and simple functioning of it too. This bench includes a variety of diffrent positions, like the 2 types of incline, the regular bench, and DECLINE,which most benches dont have. Overall this bench is going to stay in its rightful place in my garage and might even buy one for my bro.
customer_reviews.author: Donovan Stephens

customer_reviews.title: Not meant for “short” guys (6’ and under).
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy bench and easy to put together. My only complaint is that the gap between the butt/back rest is quite large so if you’re short this bench will NOT work for you. I’m 6’5” with really long legs and this bench is still almost a little too big for me if I line my head up with the end of the back rest. On the flip side it’s super simple to adjust and can be moved around with ease since it has rollers. It also looks very pleasing with the red stitching accents and black base. Great overall bench as long as you’re tall and not looking to get a crazy nice/incredibly cheap bench. It’s an awesome inbetweener.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... bench for about 1-2 weeks now and its been great, its a really good size
customer_reviews.text: I've had the bench for about 1-2 weeks now and its been great, its a really good size. It lets me workout in my bedroom along side a workout big blue ball. Its extremely easy to adjust for incline, decline and even adjusting the seat is a breeze. I don't feel any wobbles while getting my 230+lb weight getting up and down off of it. It also has a metal handle that lets you easily pickup the whole thing and easly roll it out of the way, the only think I would adivise is to put some rubber stoppers so you can easily stand it up and lean against wall, but maybe I'm not looking at it right. still great!
customer_reviews.author: Michael B.

customer_reviews.title: Functional, Sturdy and Reasonable Price
customer_reviews.text: Great functionality at a reasonable price. If you're really into weight training, you'll probably want to buy the slightly more expensive version, which has more features and settings, but this bench has all the functionality you need for a standard free weights workout. I can do flys, incline, decline, military, sit ups, dips, etc. It's also sturdily built; I move it back and forth weekly between my house and outdoor storage, and it's held up for a year no worse for the wear. The wheels are somewhat cheap and make the process of moving the bench more tedious than the more expensive version, but for my needs, this is worth the lower price.
customer_reviews.author: lostrom24

customer_reviews.title: Buy 5.1 instead if you need to adjust positions often
customer_reviews.text: The build quality is overall good. But the stitches on the side are not reliable (evidenced by the fact that I received a bench with tears but Amazon quickly resolved the issue). Some screws are perhaps not perfectly designed because the bench would wobble just a little bit. The complaint from me is that it is a *big big* hassle to adjust the positions of this bench. You kinda need to align the screws blindly and tighten them. For me, who does upper body exercises in different sets at different bench angles, this is super annoying, especially when your arms is pumped/tired and lost a bit accuracy in control. I regret not doing more research and getting the cheaper model.
customer_reviews.author: Coconut

customer_reviews.title: Missing 30% angle and not stable
customer_reviews.text: Horrible bench. When you lying down the position is so wired that you feel you have no support at all. There are 4 screws that doesn’t fit so the bench shakes. It is missing 30 degree angle which is the most important for incline chest press. I already had a flat bench at home and this one doesn’t work for me at all.
customer_reviews.author: Junyan Duan

customer_reviews.title: I realize now that I would have liked a bench with more than 3 adjustable positions
customer_reviews.text: PROS: - stable - simple enough setup, may require assistance if you're on the smaller side. - removable leg brace CONS: - the gap between the upper and lower is a bit large, can be awkward in some situations NEUTRAL: I realize now that I would have liked a bench with more than 3 adjustable positions, however it is no fault of the product. If you're looking for a 3 point adjustable bench, I'd recommend grabbing this one.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Solid, well-made bench
customer_reviews.text: Solid, well-made bench. I’ve been working out on this for about a month now and it really fits the bill for me. I only gave 4 stars because it’s not that easy to assemble and it didn’t come with the wrench as advertised so that threw me off a bit. But it’s a 5 star product once you assemble it.
customer_reviews.author: Michael A De Simone

customer_reviews.title: No, don’t do it. Trust me.
customer_reviews.text: The bench is sturdy, but the only has 3 adjustments (only 1 incline position) and the vertical position is a little too vertical. it nearly leans forward. The is pretty much no decline position. The leg cushions are also not adjustable which makes it difficult to use forcing you to squeeze your legs in between. It has a very very poor design in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great, Sturdy Product
customer_reviews.text: This was a great purchase. After spending hours researching the proper weight bench to buy I decided to spend a little extra one that would last, and I am glad that I did. This was pretty easy to put together, it looks great, and it is extremely solid. Not only is this a quality product but it stores easily and takes up minimal space in my office. With over 350 lbs on the bench (both the weights and I) I never once felt any give or movement. I have been using this with my dumbells to work out for a few months and I am extremely happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect..
customer_reviews.text: All the holes lined up and all the hardware fit with the exception of one seat back bolt which put up a stink..Much more solid than expected and thicker steel walls than some others I've seen but may not be the best for some of the giants out there throwing around tonnage..Last issue is the seat back is a bit wider than I would like because I like my shoulder blades to drop till they stop but not because it hit the seat back..Overall it's well worth the money and takes about 15 minutes to setup..
customer_reviews.author: Motorhed

customer_reviews.title: Good Utility Bench
customer_reviews.text: The bench works for my needs. However, I received the product with a damaged headrest (see pic). It must have been damaged during shipping. I contacted Bowflex, the manufacturer, and they shipped a replacement part to me free of charge. The bench is functional. I'm 6'4" and use the bench flat, inclined, and upright. They all work and I am comfortable in every position. I do believe that it is a bit overpriced, but it meets my needs.
customer_reviews.author: ABSTUBB

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy, easy to assemble, money well spent
customer_reviews.text: Awesome bench. Very sturdy and heavy duty. The gap between the back rest and the seat part is not a big deal. I barely even notice it. If it is a big deal, just shove a towel in there. This bench even declines! Very easy to assemble. It only took me about 25 minutes. The feet on the bench are also adjustable in case your floor is uneven. This bench is a little bit more expensive, but well worth the money. All of the other benches that I’ve had were unstable and cheaply made. Money well spent and I highly recommend this bench.
customer_reviews.author: Marc

customer_reviews.title: Good but far from Great!
customer_reviews.text: I really thought I was going to love this bench. I feel it wasn't thought out too well. Although I use it every time I work out it isn't the most comfortable bench to use. While using this bench on an incline your butt area doesn't have enough cushion and can make for a very uncomfortable work out. The area where you put your legs in doesn't adjust and your legs feel rather loose while in there. I will continue to use the bench but maybe the more modern bowflex bench would be a better option.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Reyes

customer_reviews.title: Hole in the seat
customer_reviews.text: The product itself is great and was fairly easy to assemble. But the seat has an obvious rip in the leather. Too much of a hassle to return something this heavy.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J Monsell

customer_reviews.title: Careful with the hardware
customer_reviews.text: Love this bench. But I was really annoyed by how the hardware is packaged. The screws/nuts/bolts were just bunched together wrapped in cellophane and bubble wrap. I couldn’t even tell what it was when I opened it. They spilled all over the floor, so I spent the first 90 minutes trying to find them and stop my pets from choking on them.
customer_reviews.author: Michael P.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Quality & Design; Good Performance. Doesn't Fold, No Full Cushion in Horizontal
customer_reviews.text: The product looks, feels, and smells like a brand new high-end car, when out of the box. Assembly is fun; low-medium difficulty, but like building a LEGO. Performs well. Seems sturdy and reliable after almost 6 months of light use. The only downsides are that it doesn't fully fold to be stored easily, and the exposed metallic frame in the lower-back area when opened to horizontal or decline positions (not sure if other adjustable designs have full coverage). Still, the product has very good quality, and is very well priced. (Review Subject To Revision With Further Use)
customer_reviews.author: Agent007

customer_reviews.title: This bench is awesome. It's really great and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This bench is awesome. It's really great and sturdy, not to mention its also super easy to assemble. I bought the Bowflex dumbbells a few months ago but I felt limited on what I could do with them, especially in regards to chest or shoulder exercises. So I decided to invest into a bench and it was a good decision. As many, my schedule is tight/busy and making it to the gym every day can be tough so increasing my workout options at home was a smart route for me to go so this was a perfect addition.
customer_reviews.author: JDWhitchurch

customer_reviews.title: Fits big asses comfortably!
customer_reviews.text: Much better looking than my old bench that had to be trashed since the adjustment mechanism conked out. This unit has a much simpler way to adjust inclination and is not prone to malfunction due to clever design. The seating as well as the back rest is well padded and comfortable. The so called big gap is not bothersome.... the touch of red makes it look so much nicer than an all black bench!
customer_reviews.author: Desiguy29

customer_reviews.title: If the price is right you'll be very happy with this.
customer_reviews.text: Love the range of motion. All materials are good quality. Padding is very good without being too soft. My only issue is when I am doing incline and reach down to grab and pull up toward chest it seems slightly unsteady. It may be my movent. I'll work on changing how I start each set and see if it alleviates the issue. Once I'm doing sets it solid a tanks.
customer_reviews.author: Me_So_Honey

customer_reviews.title: Great bench that is super comfortable and has both incline ...
customer_reviews.text: Great bench that is super comfortable and has both incline and decline which is harder to find than you would think for the price. The only issue is that since only one support beam goes down the center of the cushion it makes the seat flex way too much over time which can cause you to rock side to side a lot. It also doesnt support your butt very well after a couple months of use which basically makes it feel like youre sitting directly on the support beam.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle brown

customer_reviews.title: Great Bench
customer_reviews.text: This is an overall excellent bench, for larger men it certainly can be somewhat tight in the front so keep this in mind (I'm 6ft) but it something you can easily get used to! For anyone trying to add more angles, I would suggest using a brick cut in half. Because of the tightness in the front, I can't suggest 5/5, but if Bowflex provided multiple sized cushions for the front bar piece it would be an easy 5/5 product.
customer_reviews.author: Ascent

customer_reviews.title: Frame is welded incorrectly. Nautilus says replacement will not be shipped for over 3 months.
customer_reviews.text: Frame was welded incorrectly -- the parallel bars that the seat fits on were instead bent at an angle. Cannot finish assembling it. Called Nautilus customer service, who said a replacement would be shipped in 2-10 days. The following week they called again and said that the replacement would not be available for over 3 months. Very disappointed in their service and product quality. I want to return the bench but it's a pain to get packaged up again -- it's pretty heavy. Wishing I had never ordered it.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Maughan

customer_reviews.title: Look no further!
customer_reviews.text: This bench exceeded my expectations. I was looking into the other much cheaply priced benches in Amazon, but I can tell you, you get what you pay for. This bench is super sturdy and feels like the industrial benches at the local gyms. It’s been working out great for me.
customer_reviews.author: Arturo Mendez

customer_reviews.title: Good bench for the buck
customer_reviews.text: This is my second purchase of this item. The first one I had to sell because we needed to downsize the amount of stuff we have. Now we have a garage and I have room. I was very happy to buy this again. There is a gap, but that's expected with a bench that folds up and down. It doesn't bother me at all but it does bother some people.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Good overall bench
customer_reviews.text: I like this bench overall. I use it with dumbells, bench squats, shoulder presses, bench presses, and many others. The only exercise i don't like doing on this is benching. I'm a thinner guy, this bench is a little too wide for benching; can't seem to get my shoulder blades where i want them. It works, don't get me wrong, just not a big fan.
customer_reviews.author: Andrewl07

customer_reviews.title: Great bench for the money
customer_reviews.text: I searched all corners of the internet and I didn't find a bench that was better than this one. Easy to put together and is pretty sturdy for a home bench. I love that it does decline and 90 which are hard to find at this price point. This is the second best part of my home gym, best part of any home gym is no weird locker room with old nude dudes walking around
customer_reviews.author: JD The Wolf

customer_reviews.title: Simple and effective home workout bench.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this Bowflex bench to match my Bowflex 552 weights. I recently cancelled my gym membership and decided to work out at the comfort and privacy of my own abode. The bench was delivered post haste, and it is fairly easy to put together. Heavy weight workout bench. Quality is solid. Happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: PT

customer_reviews.title: Good overall, but mind the gap....
customer_reviews.text: Overall nice bench without a lot of the problems of the Amazon-special Chinese brands. The gap between the seats is indeed a serious design flaw (see photo with billiard ball for size). But if you use the bench mostly at 90 degrees or at incline, it’s unnoticeable. Otherwise, assembly was straightforward and it seems sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Knuckles

customer_reviews.title: Good for a home gym, but not "great".
customer_reviews.text: As many other reviewers have stated, the gap between the seat and the back rest is a bit of a pain when you are in a decline position. Also as others have stated the wheels to move it around are almost useless, unless you have the bench almost vertical. But besides those two cons, I would still recommend this unit to anyone that is looking for a home gym. For me this unit completes my needs for being able to do shoulder press, curls, incline bench, flat bench, decline bench, and crunches. The weight of the unit makes it easy enough to move around, even if the wheels are not perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Skean

customer_reviews.title: Improper design
customer_reviews.text: The bottom pad is ginormous. You won’t see that large of a butt pad in any standard gym. It makes it difficult to position your legs on the floor. Additionally it’s too high off the ground and makes it tough to pick up and set weights down while you’re on it. Wish I would have purchased something else.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew T Wilcox

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for the money
customer_reviews.text: This is a solid well made bench. The assembly of the seat was a little difficult because the pre drilled holes in the seat didn't quite line up with the holes in the frame. This was not insurmountable but did require a little twisting and torquing to assemble the seat. But once assembled the bench is sturdy. My weight added to the weight I work out with loads the bench with about 450 lbs and the bench feels solid with that amount of weight on it. That is not what is recommended by the manufacturer but just my own personal experience. One downside, the bench really needs another tilt position between 45 degrees and down flat.
customer_reviews.author: R. Murray

customer_reviews.title: Ok  it cheaper options are better
customer_reviews.text: I bought this during pandemic the bench was good and make of quality material. However i couldn’t get bottom legs bolts tight enough to stop the bottom legs from shaking. I stripped heads of 3 Allen bolts trying to tighten them. I even bought hex head bolt and they didn’t strip but the legs still moved
customer_reviews.author: Mr_Gagdet_Man

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: My only criticism of this bench is the wheels on the back which they sell as a feature. They're nonsense. Someone else had posted you need to life it practically vertical to move it. I just lift the front, move it, then lift the back and move it. And it's not so heavy you can't do this. Other than that, this is an excellent, high quality bench. And I really appreciate having the 30, 45, 60 and 90 angles. Great cushioning. Solid quality and construction. Very pleased. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good not great...
customer_reviews.text: This bench hold 300lb user and an additional 180lb weight (thats 480lb total) which is the best weight capacity for any full size bench currently in this price range. The only thing about this bench that is holding it back is the very large gap (4 inches) between the seat and back rest when in decline and flat bench positions. I am considering a couple options and have for now just kept a towel handy to put over the metal hinge for now. I am 5'10'' and it makes this bench very very uncomfortable for flat and decline. This bench DOES come with the add on leg extension, which is not pictured and it is a great bonus.
customer_reviews.author: Liggittman

customer_reviews.title: Solid bench
customer_reviews.text: very solid bench, well built bench, that is easy to move around on the the wheels. The only major drawback has to do with comfort. The gap between the lower and upper part of the bench is substantial and very uncomfortable. I've managed to deal with it by using a couple of rolled up towels to fill the gap. If they could redesign to minimize the gap, they'd have a 10/10 winner on their hands.
customer_reviews.author: Mark B. Saathoff

customer_reviews.title: New life experience
customer_reviews.text: Came shortly after ordering. The shipping box was pretty trashed though. I believe that it should have been shipped in multiple boxes after seeing the delivery service struggling with it while carrying up my 14 steps from street level. The strapping came apart. Opened it up to inspect and see if most everything was there. I was. There were no major blemishes, so I kept it. Set-up was very easy, even with my 4 & 6 year grandsons old helping me with the 'man work' as they call it. Feels sturdy even with my weight. I would buy it again, IF they broke down to multiple boxes.
customer_reviews.author: Opa Craig

customer_reviews.title: Excellent workout bench - once you get it assembled
customer_reviews.text: This is a strong, solid, and sturdy workout bench offered at a great price. Paired with some dumbbells (such as Bowflex's own SelectTech 552 adjustable weights) you can hit just about every muscle group and do a huge range of exercises. There isn't much more to say about it since it's such a simple product once assembled. Switching positions is easy, and it feels just fine. My only issue is that assembly was somewhat annoying, as it required a hex wrench which we don't have lying around here. I would have preferred if everything could have been done with an allen wrench or at least a standard screwdriver.
customer_reviews.author: Gogo

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: Pros - Built very well - Can be easily moved (has wheels) - Stury Cons - The gap between the seat and back is HUGE - the padding is a bit too soft for my liking - the leg part is in the way and doesnt actually provide any use
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Great bench
customer_reviews.text: This is a sturdy bench that had a decent price. I like to recline it all the way back for sit-ups. It works but I will say I have trouble getting adjusted around the crack where the back reclines. It’s a wide space and my butt is right on it. I am short though (5’ 3”) so it probably works better for taller folks.
customer_reviews.author: LSTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: This is a great bench. Upon delivery one of the connector pieces ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great bench. Upon delivery one of the connector pieces that goes to one of the bases was bent and would only be helped with a welder. I was able to return it and get new one. I've used it for everything a person could use a bench for. It has good cusion and good range of motion with the incline and decline.
customer_reviews.author: Amelie342

customer_reviews.title: very sturdy and compact bench
customer_reviews.text: quick to build, most all tools came with it. can change poistions in sec. covert it to do stomach crunches in one sec change. i am not a small guy and it's totally stable and sturdy bench. someone ask me why i get all bowflex machines. well it's simple. great product that will last me for years and really easy to use. i also got Bowflex SelectTech 552 Adjustable Dumbbells (Pair) i am set for life. great job guys.
customer_reviews.author: never again shop retail

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy but not a complete bench
customer_reviews.text: It is a sturdy, incline and flat bench. I was looking for a decline bench. Even though, the post claim it declines -30deg. Thats not true. More likely like -5 deg. I gave it two stars because it is a well made, sturdy, heavy bench if you are looking for a flat or incline bench. Otherwise i'll keep looking for a complete bench.
customer_reviews.author: joseph

customer_reviews.title: Adequate
customer_reviews.text: This bench seems smvery sturdy to me, at 250 pounds in sure it will hold up, the only problems i had were that one of the washers had a small rounded bit cut off the side which didnt affect it working to be honest. The second issue was that the two bars for the seat portion were basically bent towards each other making lining up the holes impossible without something to slightly bend them apart which is what i did. Its now all setup, but the seat bars were a problem that simply shouldnt have existed in the first place thats why im only giving it a four star
customer_reviews.author: Rusty Shackelford

customer_reviews.title: To my delighted surprise this bench turned out to be incredibly solid ...
customer_reviews.text: I have a home gym with high quality gear for my clients but needed a declining bench in a hurry so I bought this until I could get a professional bench. To my delighted surprise this bench turned out to be incredibly solid and well built. I honestly did not expect this level of quality for the price. Just be aware that because it is so solid, it's quite heavy for a bench. If you have a rubberized floor or rubber mats, you may find the wheels for pushing it around are too small and the edges of the feet catch the rubber. On normal flooring they work fine though.
customer_reviews.author: Shiiteetah Here

customer_reviews.title: good but not flwless
customer_reviews.text: good for price,somewhat wobely,called bowflex.thats how they all.are. seat voer came torn.rather than retuen it to amazon.icalled bowflex.who was vwer responsive ans immeadiadely sent a new seat cover. the tear in the seat cover most likely happened in shipping althogh i can not definitly say.Bowflex customer service is very response and i would reccomend bowflex products.but remeber do not expect gym quality equipment at this price levels.i kept the becnch because i do not expect the flaws to effect my home workout. The amozon price was great especially withthe instant sale price.witout the instant sale price i probably would have bought the 3.1 which would have been more than adequate for home workouts.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Steinbaum

customer_reviews.title: Good multipurpose bench
customer_reviews.text: Very stable, even on carpet. I’m over 6’ and about 240 and it’s solid. Stand/stow feature is a must for our space and this works well. Also, I was worried that the seat wouldn’t tilt, but it can in fact be angled up to match reclined back positions. Might be a bit heavy and unwieldy for a smaller person but I’m not super strong and I’m ok moving it around. Overall, glad I bought this.
customer_reviews.author: E. G.

customer_reviews.title: Good and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: We were looking for an additional weight bench and after much research settled on this one and happy that we did. It is very comfortable with good cushioning. It is easy to move with the wheels at one ends and we love the design to easily adjust the incline of the back rest. The only reason I didn't give it 5 Stars is because many weight exercises call for 30 degree decline which this unit doesn't have. However, my husband improvised with a piece of wood to meet that objective. Overall great work bench that we hope to have for many years.
customer_reviews.author: Joeykk

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy
customer_reviews.text: I have been very happy with this bench. I have had it since 2012 and it still looks and works great.
customer_reviews.author: DoctorMasterBlaster

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality. Worth the money if you are serious about working out.
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this bench every day for 3 months now. The quality is amazing. The lack of adjustment settings that are found in newer models goes unnoticed. I never need any other positions than provided here. My only complaint is the metal support bar that adjusts the bench position (extending from the back of the bench). The plastic covers that reduce the sound of metal-to-metal refuse to stay on. I wrapped them in racket grip tape. Not a big deal at all, but something Bowflex should probably address in the future. Buying a ~$160 bench is an investment for sure. This, in my opinion, was worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Langston McGee

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: Lost 2 stars because the pole that the foam inserts slide into is not the correct size and another is the design because in the middle of the bench seperating the seat and the back part there is a space which makes it very difficult to get back up if you’re benching with heavy weight.
customer_reviews.author: Eva M Monroy

customer_reviews.title: Stable, good bench.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this bench to use with a Beachbody program I am doing. I am very pleased with it so far. It is very sturdy and stable. I can step up and down on it and it doesn't move and feels secure. I just leave the foam roller thing on it and I use it as a foot rest during certain exercises (I'm short). Or my feet rest easily on the bench when laying on it. Some people commented that the feet of the bench get in the way, but I dont have any issues with that. My husband uses it as well and likes it. Assembly was easy enough. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Sharony

customer_reviews.title: Love it !!
customer_reviews.text: Love this bench. Nothing was damaged and had NO problems assembling. It's solid, sturdy, and bigger than I expected. I'm 6'2" and it's tall enough for me lay on my stomach and do incline rear delt work while supporting my entire body. For its size it's very light when it comes to moving it. The wheels on the rear make it very easy to move around as well. I'm very happy with my purchase and would recommend to anyone. It's more versatile than the benches at my gym , and those cost over $400
customer_reviews.author: jeff towner

customer_reviews.title: Buy this bench
customer_reviews.text: I've used adjustable benches at gyms that were far less stable than this guy. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: R Smith

customer_reviews.title: Awesome features
customer_reviews.text: I love how this bench has 17% decline whereas most others I saw had only 10%. The bench is well made and attractive as well as functional. It goes very well with thewithandin my basement home gym. I use this on a daily basis and it holds up very well. I use Clorox wipes to clean it off after every use and it holds up just fine. There are cheaper options for a bench but the quality really stands out on this one. If I had to do it all over again now that my gym is all put together, I would not change my decision to get this bench.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Holes were stripped right out the package
customer_reviews.text: I got this as a gift for the husband. He just started putting it together and told me that two of the holes where you would attach the pads to the metal bars are stripped. It's on the top half, but at the bottom of a set of three holes. I'm a bit disappointed but the husband says it's still functioning. Hopefully the lack of extra screws keeping the padded portion doesn't effect it's longevity. I just wanted to write about it here so you know there's the possibility of some holes being stripped and unscrewable.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara W.

customer_reviews.title: Really solid construction Very Stable Comfortable in all positions Looks good The foam of the ...
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Really solid construction Very Stable Comfortable in all positions Looks good The foam of the leg rests is surprisingly high quality. Dense enough that your legs don't hit the metal bar but not rock hard Perfect for dumbell presses. Easy to get my shoulder blades in the right position Cons: The caster wheels for transport are pretty small. You have to get the bench nearly vertical to move it and there isn't really a convenient handhold to accomplish that. Not a big deal if you aren't going to move it often.
customer_reviews.author: Mars Allred

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly high quality bench
customer_reviews.text: Extremely easy to assemble. Was shocked the quality was as good for the price. Would have liked to see another bracket or two to adjust the bench to more angles and to be able to adjust the seat and then it would be perfect but probably also twice the price. Definitely a great value.
customer_reviews.author: MazNJ

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: The bottom seat was not level due to frame factory defect. I expected better quality from bowflex. Ended buying a Merax bench for a few more $ and I am very happy with that buy.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos C. Reyes

customer_reviews.title: Nice workout bench
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for in home use. No too difficult to assemble and made of quality materials.
customer_reviews.author: SK

customer_reviews.title: Good but not without a issue
customer_reviews.text: Two of the screws I received with it did not fit. Screws were too large for any of the available holes Very disappointing coming from a brand like Bowflex. No screws in those two holes as of right now so hope it doesn't fall apart.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Seat screw pattern didn't work.
customer_reviews.text: The weight bench works like a charm. It's almost magical. But the screw pattern for the bottom seat (part number 8 in the manual) is wrong and will only go on with two screws, not the required 4. Feels a tad wobbly, but not dangerous. Other than that, it's a great, sturdy product. I'm just miffed I have to spend another 35$ on a seat!
customer_reviews.author: Xevious

customer_reviews.title: Great workout bench!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great addition to my home gym. This bench works great for my needs. It was easy to assemble, is stable, and has a high weight capacity. The padding is also fairly comfortable. This is also easy to adjust.
customer_reviews.author: KfillyTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Made terribly, not sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: Made terribly. Entire bench rocks, isn’t sturdy. Had professionally put together as well. Not worth any money for the product. Huge gap between seat and back as well with metal. Look at any other reputable bench - just not from Bowflex or the series.
customer_reviews.author: HS

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Wife wanted a flat bench but I got her this instead because I knew once we got the flat bench we'd need an incline/decline. Great quality and sturdy. The only thing I'd recommend be added is the degree slop for the back adjustments. I marked the angles at each notch with a permanent marker.
customer_reviews.author: Zoran

customer_reviews.title: Solid Bench
customer_reviews.text: Nice sturdy bench. I wished the seat did angle up a bit as you tend to slide down when doing angled exercises. Was easy to put together, despite a few screws to wrench on pretty hard to make fit. However, it's sturdy once put together and is perfect for basement workouts.
customer_reviews.author: RayBran

customer_reviews.title: relatively stable easy to look at works well for flat and incline ...
customer_reviews.text: pros: relatively stable easy to look at works well for flat and incline settings easy assembly cons: pretty big foot print padding feels a bit too thin, not the most comfortable while flat decline position is almost worthless due to the large gap that appears between the seat and backrest. tailbone ends up riding on a thin piece of metal. uncomfortable, and probably not the safest for pushing weight.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Newport

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Bench!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a bench that had several positions including a decline position and this one has it all. The bench has a really huge seat compared to other benches. It is super comfortable. Great bench. I highly recommend it. Also a fantastic price.
customer_reviews.author: Ginger Hudson

customer_reviews.title: Great home exercise bench.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this and the dumbells as I was tired driving to the gym and waiting to use a piece of exercise equipment. So my son and I set up a small home gym in the garage. I just bought the Bowflex gear and am really happy with it. Assembly wasn't that hard, they supply all the tools and adequate instructions. Overall really happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Philip A. Parker

customer_reviews.title: Beat Adjustable Bench for home
customer_reviews.text: This bench was a holiday gift for an in-home gym and they love it. They said it was easy to assemble and I have seen it and it is very functional and attractive. Perfect for their 12 x 12 foot room.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Hawkins

customer_reviews.title: Very Well Made
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic Bench, with enough support it won’t rock or rattle one bit. And I’m 220+ lifting no less than 100 at a time. That’s all you can ask for in a bench. And the fact it’s actually comfortable. Don’t give too much attention to petty complaints. Nothing does everything. But this is a huge value when on sale near $100!
customer_reviews.author: M. Geng

customer_reviews.title: I feel like it is somewhat bulky
customer_reviews.text: Okay product. The bench is heavy in the sense that it is strong. I feel like it is somewhat bulky. It is bigger than it needs to be. The lock that is supposed to effortlessly set in place based on the position you choose but it gets stuck sometimes and if not careful, you could injure yourself. Make sure the bench is locked.
customer_reviews.author: Sunny

customer_reviews.title: No customer service
customer_reviews.text: Kit had 2 damaged washers. Are necessary to assemble properly. You can email customer service, and they immediately reply that you have to call them. Impossible to get through--perpetually on hold. Embarrassing.
customer_reviews.author: R. Brent Jones

customer_reviews.title: Great bench. Took about 30 mins to put it ...
customer_reviews.text: Great bench. Took about 30 mins to put it together, but could have been quicker, if... Tip: When attaching the seat, do NOT tighten the screws, but simply START each one a LITTLE bit. Once all 4 are started, then go ahead and tighten them. They are ever so slightly off (which should ensure the seat never wiggles) ... but I tightened my first 3 and could NOT get the 4th one lined up. Wasted a lot of time on that.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie W

customer_reviews.title: Holes not lining up.
customer_reviews.text: So I finally put this together after about a week of its siting here. There are not many parts so that was nice, however, when I went to put the cushions on the bench the holes on the cushions do not line up with the holes on the metal part of the bench. So one of the cushions is not attached all the way. Sorry the picture is blurry. I have not used it yet.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Delivery poor...dealt with...nice bench.
customer_reviews.text: Product delivered open. Pieces falling out of the box. Nice. I will update my review when I see if anything was damaged. Edit: An Amazon rep called me back right away, and offered to make it right for me. I was pleased with the response. Only one part was damaged, but I chose to keep it. The bench seems to be sturdy and functional. Just what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Erik Bruce Husbands

customer_reviews.title: Good bench
customer_reviews.text: Bench is stable but I don’t like the position of the legs as they are right where I would normally put my feet.. just need to get used to it I guess
customer_reviews.author: Michele

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality for a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.text: After many hours of research and reading countless reviews I decided to purchase the Bowflex bench and have never looked back. For just a few dollars more than some of the lesser know/lesser quality brands, this is a bargain for the quality you receive. It is a solid bench with excellent adjustability and nice fit and finish. It nicer than many other benches I looked at that were significantly higher priced. Yet another quality product from Bowflex. I would definitely purchase this item again.
customer_reviews.author: Taunya Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Defective and no product support
customer_reviews.text: My item was defective and was not able to adjust I tried contacting Bowflex and the wait time was 300 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny. If ever sold, I'll probably make money
customer_reviews.text: Had this 4 months now. Wasn't writing a quick review until I truly had a chance to put it through the paces. I'm a big guy, 6'1" and 302lbs. Same solid beautiful machine as the day I had my first workout, putting it together. Rugged, well designed - like a German did it. No loose seats, no tears on upholstery, the Teflon nuts never loosen on you. I workout every day for half an hour like I'm possessed. I'm ashamed to say, "I couldn't hurt it at all", just a shiny spot where my hair product protects the sheen.
customer_reviews.author: C. Docken

customer_reviews.title: Parts don't fit together.
customer_reviews.text: Just starting putting it together and the front stabilizer wont fit into the main body of the bench. Tried to call support, only open monday through friday during business hours. but they want you to be by your product... Who is going to stay at home from work to talk to bowflex customer support because their quality control is severely lacking? Tried their chat program, told me to call the support line. no help. Then tried to take their survey and their open field to provide comments wont accept but a short sentence. pretty clear they don't want to actually hear what you have to say. Last bowflex product i buy.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Laster

customer_reviews.title: Great bench at great price
customer_reviews.text: Arrived promptly and was easy to assemble, everything matched up perfectly. Very sturdy bench. Looks like the 3.1 is a discontinued model but I don't see any difference with the 4.1. Cannot beat this pricing!
customer_reviews.author: D. Fraser

product_meta.title: Bowflex SelectTech Adjustable Bench Series
feature_bullets: The Bowflex 5.1 Adjustable Bench is an outstanding addition to any workout space
Transform any space into a personal free weight fitness center
Adjusts to six different positions, 17-degree decline to 90-degree incline
Comes with a removable leg hold-down brace for added decline position support
Corrects posture and stabilizes positioning for a safe, muscle-building free-weight workout
30-year warranty on frame, one-year warranty on upholstery

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
